name: Datastore
description:
The gcloud.datastore object gives you some convenience methods, as well as exposes a dataset function. This will allow you to create a dataset, which is the object from which you will interact with the Google Cloud Datastore.

To learn more about Datastore, read the Google Cloud Datastore Concepts Overview.

methods.name: Datastore
methods.description: The example below will demonstrate the different usage patterns your app may need to support to retrieve a datastore object.

methods.name: dataset
methods.description: Create a Dataset object to reference an existing dataset.

params.name: options.apiEndpoint
params.description: • Override the default API endpoint used to reach Datastore. This is useful for connecting to your local Datastore server (usually "http://localhost:8080").

methods.name: int
methods.description: Helper function to get a Datastore Integer object.

methods.name: double
methods.description: Helper function to get a Datastore Double object.
